subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Qualifying for the Pepsi 400 in Daytona, Fla., was rained out yesterday, leaving several teams out of the season’s second race at Nascar’s most storied track. Jeff Gordon, the Nextel Cup series points leader, was awarded the pole. Denny Hamlin will start second, followed by Matt Kenseth, Jimmie Johnson and Jeff Burton. Boris Said was sitting on the pole before steady rain forced officials to cancel the qualifying session with 14 cars left to make runs. Nascar uses owner points to set the starting grid when qualifying is canceled.
